job_description: DevOps Engineer - job post AlignTech 161 reviews San Jose, CA 95134 • Hybrid remote $144,600 - $165,500 a year -  Internship You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $144,600 - $165,500 a year Job Type Internship Join a team that is changing millions of lives. Transforming smiles, changing lives. At Align Technology, we believe a great smile can transform a person’s life, so we create technology that gives people the confidence to take on whatever’s next. We revolutionized the orthodontic industry with the introduction of the Invisalign system, and we have never lost sight of that spirit of innovation. Our diverse and collaborative teams are constantly pushing the boundaries of what’s possible. Ready to join us? About this opportunity The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for the designing and implementing tasks that supports Consumer Web/API Team for Align Technology. The Consumer Applications Devops Engineer is responsible for building APIs and maintaining the build and deploy process of existing applications using AWS infrastructure and Kubernetes. As a Devops Engineer, the candidate will be a strong contributor in the execution of the strategic direction for the company, the success of this position will be measured by the usability, quality, and timeliness of applications delivery. You will participate on building apis, establishing the build scripts and maintaining the applications. The ideal candidate is expected to have proven extensive experience in API building, AWS infrastructure management and Kubernetes setup. In this role, you will… Manage cloud infrastructure and services through the use and promotion of Infrastructure-as-Code tools. Responsible or building API’s using Python & Fast API Collaborate with development teams on implementing deployment and packaging automation for their apps using Fargate (AWS ECS, EKS), Docker, Cold containers, or other appropriate technologies. Design, build and manage ELK /Open search clusters for centralized logging and search functionalities. Build out and maintain Kubernetes Infrastructure and CI/CD for developers. Advocate and implement the use of reliable design patterns across the software organization Improve the monitoring and observability of services and their health Enable self-service deploys and service requests to continually reduce deployment toil Manage changes according to change management policies and processes and adhere to established change management and change control systems. Provide support to CICD method and help with standardizing and automating workflows and tasks. Participate in strategic projects to improve Aligns approach to cloud-based infrastructure and application deployment. Develop solutions to automate repetitive tasks, monitor system health, create, and update real-time inventories and reports, and improve existing processes. Responsible for working with business owners to propose high-quality user experience solutions for desktop and mobile web applications. Responsible for working with the configuration management and administration teams to provide accurate build and deployment instructions. Responsible for working with tertiary groups such as Security, Architecture, IT Operations, and QA to ensure quality design, delivery, and adherence to corporate standards. Ensure application development principles, standards, and best practices are followed for each project. Provide support to audit processes and quality management system as required. In this role, you’ll need … Educational Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related discipline, or equivalent years of experience Masters will be preferred. Required Experience: 5+ years of Software or System Engineering experience. 4+ Experience with Cloud Computing with AWS & GCP. 4+ Experience with Docker, Kubernetes. 4 years of overall web development experience, preferably secure, scalable web applications in Java, Node or Python Strong Experience working as DevOps engineer with focus on automation. Strong Experience with Infrastructure as Code using tool like CloudFormation or Terraform Strong Experience with CICD tool/pipeline (Bamboo, Jenkins), Configuration management (Chef, Ansible) and version control (Git). Experience with Build and Release process. Experience with Monitoring and Alerting tools like Open Search, Splunk, New Relic. Expertise with cloud security, understand the principle of least privilege. Ability to document complex architectural concepts and solutions in both business and technical terms. Proven strong skills in critical thinking and analysis, verbal and written communications, and interpersonal interactions. Proven track record of working in an agile methodology and knowledgeable with SCRUM framework. Required Technical Skills Basic understanding of System engineering concepts like load balancing, capacity planning, firewalls, SSL etc. 3+ years of experience with Terraform or Chef. 3+ years of experience with container orchestration services including Docker or Kubernetes Experience with Atlassian toolsets a plus. AWS Solution Architect (Associate or Pro) certification is preferred. AWS Certified SysOps Administrator certification is preferred. AWS Certified DevOps Engineer is a plus. Required Soft Skills Team Player. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Effective communications. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Self-Motivated and Independent worker. Customer focus – takes ownership of issues and seeing issues through to resolution. Sound like a good fit? Great! Click the "Apply" link to let us know you are interested. Not the right fit? Don’t worry, Align is quickly growing so we are creating more opportunities to expand our Align family. Please consider joining our Talent Network to receive notifications about future jobs or sharing this opportunity with others in your network. About Align Align Technology is a publicly traded medical device company that is transforming smiles and changing lives . Our global team of talented employees develop innovative technology, tools and treatment options to help dental professionals worldwide achieve the clinical results they expect. Our digital ecosystem combines the power of technology to create beautiful smiles through the integration of AI and machine learning, digital imaging and visualization, biomechanics and material science to develop the Invisalign system, the most advanced clear aligner system in the world; iTero Intraoral Scanners and OrthoCAD digital services. Did you know? Align is the world’s largest manufacturer of custom 3D-printed materials. By joining Align, you will be part of a global, fast-growing company in one of the most dynamic industries. Great people, innovative technologies, and meaningful work – these are just some of the things employees say make Align Technology a great place to work. We respect your privacy. Please review our Applicant Privacy Policies for additional information. Global Diversity Statement: At Align, we believe in the power of a smile, and we know that every smile is as unique as our employees. As we grow, we will continue building a workforce of diverse cultural backgrounds and life experiences and fostering a culture of open-mindedness and compassion for all our employees. We live our company values by promoting healthy people and healthy communities. All with the intent of changing millions of lives, one unique smile at a time. Equal Opportunity Statement It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, protected veteran status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category. Applicants for positions with Align must be legally authorized to work in the country which they are applying for and verification of employment eligibility will be required as a condition of hire. #LI-Hybrid Primary Location Base Salary Range: $144,600 to 165,500 USD Base salary ranges are a guideline used to determine appropriate pay. Placement depends on the individual skills and experience level of a candidate plus the total compensation and equity across team members. For other locations outside of the primary location, the base salary range will be adjusted geographically. For field Sales roles, the salary listed is the base pay only and does not include the applicable commission plan. A cost of living adjustment may be added to base pay for higher cost areas in the U.S. Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay determined based on the position and your location, year in school, degree, and experience.
